body: Is it for Android OS or ARM on Linux?

This is how I cross-compile it for ARM Linux:
```bash
sudo apt-get install -y qemu-user-static
cat << EOF > tool-chain.cmake
SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME Linux)
SET(CMAKE_SYSTEM_VERSION 1)
SET(CMAKE_C_COMPILER aarch64-linux-gnu-gcc)
SET(CMAKE_C_FLAGS "-march=armv8-a -mtune=generic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-type-limits")
SET(CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER aarch64-linux-gnu-g++)
SET(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "-march=armv8-a -mtune=generic -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-type-limits")
SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH /mnt/toolchains/manylinux2014_aarch64)
SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_PROGRAM NEVER)
SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_LIBRARY ONLY)
SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_INCLUDE ONLY)
SET(CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH_MODE_PACKAGE ONLY)
EOF
export PATH=/mnt/toolchains/gcc-linaro-7.5.0-2019.12-x86_64_aarch64-linux-gnu/bin:$PATH
mkdir -p /tmp/build
azcopy cp https://onnxruntimetestdata.blob.core.windows.net/models/toolchains.tar.xz /tmp/build/toolchains.tar.xz
sudo rm -rf /mnt/toolchains
sudo mkdir /mnt/toolchains
sudo tar -Jxf /tmp/build/toolchains.tar.xz -C /mnt/toolchains
aria2c -q https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/releases/download/v3.11.1/protoc-3.11.1-linux-x86_64.zip
unzip protoc-3.11.1-linux-x86_64.zip
sudo cp /mnt/toolchains/manylinux2014_aarch64/usr/include/stdlib.h /mnt/toolchains/gcc-linaro-7.5.0-2019.12-x86_64_aarch64-linux-gnu/aarch64-linux-gnu/libc/usr/include/
cmake \
-Donnxruntime_GCC_STATIC_CPP_RUNTIME=ON \
-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release \
-Dprotobuf_WITH_ZLIB=OFF \
-DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=tool-chain.cmake \
-Donnxruntime_ENABLE_PYTHON=ON \
-DPYTHON_LIBRARY=dl \
-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=/mnt/toolchains/manylinux2014_aarch64/opt/python/cp35-cp35m/bin/python3  \
-Donnxruntime_BUILD_SHARED_LIB=OFF \
-Donnxruntime_RUN_ONNX_TESTS=OFF \
-Donnxruntime_DEV_MODE=ON \
-DONNX_CUSTOM_PROTOC_EXECUTABLE=/tmp/build/bin/protoc \
"-DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR=/mnt/toolchains/manylinux2014_aarch64/usr/include;/mnt/toolchains/manylinux2014_aarch64/opt/python/cp35-cp35m/include/python3.5m" \
-DNUMPY_INCLUDE_DIR=/mnt/toolchains cmake
```

Thanks for reply!

I'm not sure which is correct, but I think mine should be work like Linux
on ARM.
I used Termux app to try this.

Seems you're directly buidling onnxruntime on an ARM device, then it's not cross-compile, please don't use the instruction above, and do not define ONNX_CUSTOM_PROTOC_EXECUTABLE.

Is there anyone who has an idea to fix this?
To reproduce problems instantly, just do following things on TermuxApp running on Android.
```
git clone --recursive https://github.com/Microsoft/onnxruntime
cd onnxruntime
./build.sh --config RelWithDebInfo --build_shared_lib --parallel
```

Since error says "No target "protobuf::protoc"", I thought protobuf can't be found somehow, but I can't find solutions to fix this.

My guess is that in cmake\CMakeLists.txt, there is the following block that disables building the protoc binary that the rest of the build is expecting to have available. This check probably needs to be refined to be more specific to the cross-compilation scenario. For the iOS build, this switch is set in tools\ci_build\build.py instead. Maybe the same could be done here too. Adding @gwang-msft to comment.

Commenting out the below lines would likely get your build to work.

  if (CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME STREQUAL "Android")
    set(protobuf_BUILD_PROTOC_BINARIES OFF CACHE BOOL "Build protobuf tests" FORCE)
  endif()

Hi @tracysh , Thanks for suggestion!

I tried editing CMakeLists.txt to comment out those lines, but, unfortunately,  still keep getting same error saying "No target "protobuf::protoc""...

@AiueoABC, when you tried this out, did you also delete the existing build directory? I am seeing in my local build that if I have the "set(protobuf_BUILD_PROTOC_BINARIES OFF CACHE BOOL "Build protobuf tests" FORCE)" in my cmakelists.txt for a Windows x64 build, then I see the same errors as above. If I then just comment out the line, then the old value is still cached and I continue to see the error. Uncommenting the line and changing the OFF to ON does then allow the build to work, or leaving the line commented out, deleting the old build directory, and restarting the build works too. Hope that helps!

Thanks @tracysh , 
I noticed I didn't erase build directory, so I erased it.
I managed to pass protobuf problem with with your suggestion!
Thank you so much!

BTW, I got another different error related to "NEON".
I will try to understand what is the problem for this, it seems this script it failed to include arm_neon.h

When I see inside "arm_neon.h" file, it says
```
#ifndef __ARM_NEON_H
#define __ARM_NEON_H
#if !defined(__ARM_NEON)
#error "NEON support not enabled"
#endif
```
Should I define something for "__ARM_NEON" at somewhere?

What is CMAKE_ANDROID_ARCH_ABI set to in your build environment? For 32-bit ARM, it needs to be armeabi-v7a to turn on NEON support. The option armeabi doesn't automatically turn on NEON and will fail to pull in other files (see onnxruntime_mlas.cmake). What type of processor are you attempting to build on?

Thank you for answering @tracysh !

I think I didn't set it. I will set it correctly.
In my case, I think I should set like below? I just changed last 2 chars from yours.
export CMAKE_ARGS="-DCMAKE_ANDROID_ARCH_ABI=armeabi-v8l"
I will try with this.
